intro: Byttneria biloba subsp. grandidieri, commonly known as the Madagascar silk tree, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and produces showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in moist, well-drained soils. Its unique appearance and ornamental value make it a popular choice for gardens and conservation efforts.
